revised_title: Anatomical and Microscopic Analysis of Asiatic Cholera Cases in Italy
tldr: The author conducted an anatomical and microscopic analysis of 25 fatal cases of Asiatic cholera in Italy. They found comma-shaped bacilli in 13 cases, which were associated with acute inflammation in the intestinal wall. The study also revealed that these bacilli were not present in every case and were not found in blood vessels. The author concludes that further research is needed to understand the relationship between these bacilli and cholera.
